oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US model 1855 double bag knapsack
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1855 was the standard US issued knapsack. It is made of painted linen with leather straps. Most US infantry and artillery soldiers were issued this pattern of knapsack to carry their personal items, clothing, and blanket. This one was probably never issued and later sold as surplus after the war.
